pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing suspension

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:0.4.eng: The training rule on one who gives the full admission to a female criminal

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena vesāliyaṃ aññatarassa licchavissa pajāpati aticārinī hoti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:1.2.eng: At that time in Vesālī the wife of a certain Licchavī man was unfaithful.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:1.3.pli: Atha kho so licchavi taṃ itthiṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:1.4.eng: “Please stop. If you don’t, I’ll punish you.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:1.6.pli: Tena kho pana samayena vesāliyaṃ licchavigaṇo sannipatito hoti kenacideva karaṇīyena.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:1.6.eng: Just then in Vesālī the Licchavī clan had gathered on some business.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:1.7.pli: Atha kho so licchavi te licchavayo etadavoca—
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:1.7.eng: That Licchavī man said to them,

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:1.8.eng: “Sirs, please give me permission in regard to one of my wives.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:1.10.eng: “She’s unfaithful. I wish to kill her.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:1.11.comm: Jānāhi, literally, “You know.” The implied meaning is not clear. However, in commenting on a different passage, one of the sub-commentaries, Sp-ṭ 4.330, defines the word as follows: Jānāhīti cettha paṭipajjāti attho veditabbo, “And here the meaning of ‘you know’ is to be understood as ‘you undertake’.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:1.13.eng: that her husband wanted to kill her,

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:1.14.pli: Varabhaṇḍaṃ ādāya sāvatthiṃ gantvā titthiye upasaṅkamitvā pabbajjaṃ yāci.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:1.14.eng: she took their most valuable possessions and went to Sāvatthī. There she went to the monastics of other religions and asked for the going forth,

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:1.16.eng: She then went to the Buddhist nuns and again asked for the going forth,

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:1.18.pli: Thullanandaṃ bhikkhuniṃ upasaṅkamitvā bhaṇḍakaṃ dassetvā pabbajjaṃ yāci.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:1.18.eng: She then went to the nun Thullanandā, showed her the goods, and once again asked for the going forth.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:1.19.eng: Thullanandā took the goods and gave her the going forth.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:1.20.pli: Atha kho so licchavi taṃ itthiṃ gavesanto sāvatthiṃ gantvā bhikkhunīsu pabbajitaṃ disvāna yena rājā pasenadi kosalo tenupasaṅkami;
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:1.20.eng: That Licchavī man then went to Sāvatthī in search of his wife. When he saw that she had been given the going forth as a nun, he went to King Pasenadi of Kosala

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:1.22.pli: “pajāpati me, deva, varabhaṇḍaṃ ādāya sāvatthiṃ anuppattā.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:1.22.eng: “Sir, my wife took my most valuable possessions and came to Sāvatthī.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:1.23.eng: Please permit me to deal with her.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:1.24.eng: “Well then, find her and then inform me.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:1.25.eng: “I’ve seen her. She’s gone forth as a nun.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:1.26.pli: “Sace, bhaṇe, bhikkhunīsu pabbajitā, na sā labbhā kiñci kātuṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:1.26.eng: “If she’s gone forth as a nun, there’s nothing that can be done.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:1.27.pli: Svākkhāto bhagavatā dhammo, caratu brahmacariyaṃ sammā dukkhassa antakiriyāyā”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:1.27.eng: The Teaching of the Buddha is well-proclaimed. Let her practice the spiritual life for the full ending of suffering.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:1.28.pli: Atha kho so licchavi ujjhāyati khiyyati vipāceti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:1.28.eng: Then that Licchavī man complained and criticized the nuns,

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:1.29.eng: “How could the nuns give the going forth to a criminal?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:1.30.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhuniyo tassa licchavissa ujjhāyantassa khiyyantassa vipācentassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:1.30.eng: The nuns heard the complaints of that Licchavī man,

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:1.31.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:1.31.eng: and the nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:1.32.eng: “How could Venerable Thullanandā give the going forth to a criminal?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:1.33.pli: Atha kho tā bhikkhuniyo bhikkhūnaṃ etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ …pe…

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:1.34.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, thullanandā bhikkhunī coriṃ pabbājetī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:1.34.eng: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Thullanandā did this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:1.37.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, thullanandā bhikkhunī coriṃ pabbājessati.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:1.37.eng: “How could the nun Thullanandā give the going forth to a criminal?

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:1.39.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:1.39.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:1.40.1.pli: “Yā pana bhikkhunī jānaṃ coriṃ vajjhaṃ viditaṃ anapaloketvā rājānaṃ vā saṅghaṃ vā gaṇaṃ vā pūgaṃ vā seṇiṃ vā aññatra kappā vuṭṭhāpeyya, ayampi bhikkhunī paṭhamāpattikaṃ dhammaṃ āpannā nissāraṇīyaṃ saṅghādisesan”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:1.40.1.eng: ‘If a nun, without getting permission from the king or the Sangha or a community or an association or a society, knowingly gives the full admission to a female criminal who is known as sentenced to death, then, except when it is allowable, that nun too has committed an immediate offense entailing sending away and suspension.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:2.1.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:2.1.6.pli: sāmaṃ vā jānāti aññe vā tassā ārocenti, sā vā āroceti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:2.1.6.eng: she knows by herself or others have told her or she has told her.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:2.1.8.pli: yā pañcamāsakaṃ vā atirekapañcamāsakaṃ vā agghanakaṃ adinnaṃ theyyasaṅkhātaṃ ādiyati, esā corī nāma.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:2.1.8.eng: any female who has stolen anything worth five māsaka coins or more is called “a female criminal”.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:2.1.10.eng: she has been sentenced to death because of her action.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:2.1.12.eng: it is known to other people that she has been sentenced to death.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:2.1.16.eng: where a king reigns, permission should be obtained from the king.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:2.1.18.eng: what is meant is the Sangha of nuns, and permission should be obtained from that Sangha.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:2.1.20.eng: where a community governs, permission should be obtained from that community.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:2.1.22.eng: where an association governs, permission should be obtained from that association.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:2.1.24.eng: where a society governs, permission should be obtained from that society.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:2.1.28.pli: dve kappāni— titthiyesu vā pabbajitā hoti aññāsu vā bhikkhunīsu pabbajitā.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:2.1.28.eng: there are two allowable situations: she has gone forth with monastics of another religion or she has gone forth with other Buddhist nuns.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:2.1.29.pli: Aññatra kappā “vuṭṭhāpessāmī”ti gaṇaṃ vā ācariniṃ vā pattaṃ vā cīvaraṃ vā pariyesati, sīmaṃ vā sammannati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:2.1.29.eng: If, intending to give the full admission, she searches for a group, a teacher, a bowl, or a robe, or she establishes a monastery zone, then, except when it is allowable, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:2.1.30.eng: After the motion, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:2.1.30.comm: The Pali just says dukkaṭa, without specifying that it is an āpatti, “an offense”. Yet elsewhere, such as at Bu Ss 10:2.65, the dukkaṭa is annulled if you commit the full offense of saṅghādisesa. The implication is that in these contexts dukkaṭa should be read as āpatti dukkaṭassa, “an offense of wrong conduct”.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:2.1.31.eng: After each of the first two announcements, she commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:2.1.32.eng: When the last announcement is finished, the preceptor commits an offense entailing suspension,

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:2.1.33.pli: Gaṇassa ca ācariniyā ca āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:2.1.33.eng: and the group and the teacher commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:2.1.35.eng: this is said with reference to the preceding offense.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:2.1.37.eng: there is an offense as soon as the misconduct is committed, and no pressing is required.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:2.1.39.eng: she is sent away from the Sangha.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:2.1.41.eng: … Therefore, too, it is called an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:2.2.1.pli: Coriyā corisaññā aññatra kappā vuṭṭhāpeti, āpatti saṅghādisesassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:2.2.1.eng: If she is a criminal, and the nun perceives her as such, and she gives her the full admission, except when it is allowable, she commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:2.2.2.pli: Coriyā vematikā aññatra kappā vuṭṭhāpeti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:2.2.2.eng: If she is a criminal, but the nun is unsure of it, and she gives her the full admission, except when it is allowable, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:2.2.3.pli: Coriyā acorisaññā aññatra kappā vuṭṭhāpeti, anāpatti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:2.2.3.eng: If she is a criminal, but the nun does not perceive her as such, and she gives her the full admission, except when it is allowable, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:2.2.4.eng: If she is not a criminal, but the nun perceives her as such, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:2.2.5.eng: If she is not a criminal, but the nun is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:2.2.6.eng: If she is not a criminal, and the nun does not perceive her as such, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:2.3.2.eng: if she gives her the full admission without knowing that she is a criminal;

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:2.3.3.eng: if she gives her the full admission after getting permission;

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:2.3.4.eng: if she gives her the full admission when it is allowable;

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:2.3.6.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:2.3.7.eng: The second offense entailing suspension is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing suspension

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:0.4.eng: The training rule on walking alone to the next village

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhaddāya kāpilāniyā antevāsinī bhikkhunī bhikkhunīhi saddhiṃ bhaṇḍitvā gāmakaṃ ñātikulaṃ agamāsi.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:1.2.eng: a nun who was a pupil of Bhaddā Kāpilānī had an argument with the nuns and then went to her relatives’ village.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:1.3.pli: Bhaddā kāpilānī taṃ bhikkhuniṃ apassantī bhikkhuniyo pucchi—“kahaṃ itthannāmā, na dissatī”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:1.3.eng: Not seeing her pupil anywhere, Bhaddā Kāpilānī asked the nuns, “Where’s so-and-so? She’s disappeared.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:1.4.eng: “She disappeared, Venerable, after arguing with the nuns.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:1.5.pli: “Ammā, amukasmiṃ gāmake etissā ñātikulaṃ. Tattha gantvā vicinathā”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:1.5.eng: “My dears, her relatives live in such-and-such a village. Go there and look for her.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:1.6.pli: Bhikkhuniyo tattha gantvā taṃ bhikkhuniṃ passitvā etadavocuṃ—“kissa tvaṃ, ayye, ekikā āgatā, kaccisi appadhaṃsitā”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:1.6.eng: The nuns went there, and when they saw her, they said to her, “Why did you go alone, Venerable? We hope you weren’t assaulted?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:1.8.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:1.8.eng: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:1.9.eng: “How could a nun walk to the next village by herself?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:1.10.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, bhikkhunī ekā gāmantaraṃ gacchatī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:1.10.eng: “Is it true, monks, that a nun did this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:1.13.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, bhikkhunī ekā gāmantaraṃ gacchissati.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:1.15.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:1.15.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:1.16.1.pli: “Yā pana bhikkhunī ekā gāmantaraṃ gaccheyya, ayampi bhikkhunī paṭhamāpattikaṃ dhammaṃ āpannā nissāraṇīyaṃ saṅghādisesan”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:1.16.1.eng: ‘If a nun walks to the next inhabited area by herself, then that nun too has committed an immediate offense entailing sending away and suspension.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:1.17.pli: Evañcidaṃ bhagavatā bhikkhunīnaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:1.17.eng: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the nuns.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena dve bhikkhuniyo sāketā sāvatthiṃ addhānamaggappaṭipannā honti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:2.1.eng: On one occasion two nuns were traveling from Sāketa to Sāvatthī.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:2.2.eng: On the way they had to cross a river.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:2.3.pli: Atha kho tā bhikkhuniyo nāvike upasaṅkamitvā etadavocuṃ—“sādhu no, āvuso, tārethā”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:2.3.eng: They went to a boatman and said, “Please take us across.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:2.4.eng: “I’m not able, Venerables, to take both of you across at the same time.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:2.5.eng: And so they crossed individually, alone with the boatman.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:2.6.eng: When he had crossed with the first nun, he raped her.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:2.6.comm: “Raped” renders dūsesi. For a discussion of this word, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:2.7.eng: And after returning to the first bank, he raped the other nun as well.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:2.8.eng: Later, when they were reunited, they asked each other,

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:2.11.eng: And you, Venerable, were you assaulted?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:2.13.pli: Atha kho tā bhikkhuniyo sāvatthiṃ gantvā bhikkhunīnaṃ etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:2.13.eng: They then continued on to Sāvatthī and told the nuns there what had happened.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:2.14.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:2.14.eng: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:2.15.eng: “How could a nun cross a river by herself?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:2.16.pli: Atha kho tā bhikkhuniyo bhikkhūnaṃ etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:2.17.eng: who in turn told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:2.18.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, bhikkhunī ekā nadīpāraṃ gacchatī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:2.18.eng: “Is it true, monks, that a nun did this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:2.21.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, bhikkhunī ekā nadīpāraṃ gacchissati.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:2.23.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:2.23.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:2.24.1.pli: “Yā pana bhikkhunī ekā vā gāmantaraṃ gaccheyya, ekā vā nadīpāraṃ gaccheyya, ayampi bhikkhunī paṭhamāpattikaṃ dhammaṃ āpannā nissāraṇīyaṃ saṅghādisesan”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:2.24.1.eng: ‘If a nun walks to the next inhabited area by herself or crosses a river by herself, then that nun too has committed an immediate offense entailing sending away and suspension.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:2.25.pli: Evañcidaṃ bhagavatā bhikkhunīnaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:2.25.eng: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the nuns.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:3.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sambahulā bhikkhuniyo kosalesu janapade sāvatthiṃ gacchantā sāyaṃ aññataraṃ gāmaṃ upagacchiṃsu.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:3.1.eng: On one occasion a number of nuns were walking through the Kosalan country on their way to Sāvatthī, when one evening they arrived at a certain village.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:3.2.pli: Tattha aññatarā bhikkhunī abhirūpā hoti dassanīyā pāsādikā. Aññataro puriso tassā bhikkhuniyā saha dassanena paṭibaddhacitto hoti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:3.2.eng: One of the nuns was beautiful and graceful, and a certain man fell in love with her as soon as he saw her.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:3.3.pli: Atha kho so puriso tāsaṃ bhikkhunīnaṃ seyyaṃ paññapento tassā bhikkhuniyā seyyaṃ ekamantaṃ paññāpesi.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:3.3.eng: Then, as he was preparing sleeping places for those nuns, he prepared hers to one side.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:3.4.pli: Atha kho sā bhikkhunī sallakkhetvā—“pariyuṭṭhito ayaṃ puriso; sace rattiṃ āgacchissati, vissaro me bhavissatī”ti,
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:3.4.eng: And that nun thought, “This man is obsessed with me. If I go there for the night, I’ll get into trouble.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:3.5.pli: bhikkhuniyo anāpucchā aññataraṃ kulaṃ gantvā seyyaṃ kappesi.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:3.5.eng: Then, without informing the nuns, she went to a certain family and slept there.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:3.6.pli: Atha kho so puriso rattiṃ āgantvā taṃ bhikkhuniṃ gavesanto bhikkhuniyo ghaṭṭesi.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:3.6.eng: When night arrived, that man went searching for that nun, and as he did so he bumped into the other nuns.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:3.7.pli: Bhikkhuniyo taṃ bhikkhuniṃ apassantiyo evamāhaṃsu—“nissaṃsayaṃ kho sā bhikkhunī purisena saddhiṃ nikkhantā”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:3.7.eng: Not seeing that nun anywhere, the nuns said, “No doubt she has left with a man.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:3.8.pli: Atha kho sā bhikkhunī tassā rattiyā accayena yena tā bhikkhuniyo tenupasaṅkami. Bhikkhuniyo taṃ bhikkhuniṃ etadavocuṃ—“kissa tvaṃ, ayye, purisena saddhiṃ nikkhantā”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:3.8.eng: The following morning that nun returned to the nuns, and they said to her, “Venerable, why did you leave with a man?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:3.9.eng: “I didn’t leave with a man, Venerables.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:3.10.eng: She then told the nuns what had happened.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:3.11.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:3.11.eng: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:3.12.eng: “How could a nun spend the night apart by herself?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:3.13.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, bhikkhunī ekā rattiṃ vippavasatī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:3.13.eng: “Is it true, monks, that a nun did this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:3.16.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, bhikkhunī ekā rattiṃ vippavasissati.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:3.18.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:3.18.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:3.19.1.pli: “Yā pana bhikkhunī ekā vā gāmantaraṃ gaccheyya, ekā vā nadīpāraṃ gaccheyya, ekā vā rattiṃ vippavaseyya, ayampi bhikkhunī paṭhamāpattikaṃ dhammaṃ āpannā nissāraṇīyaṃ saṅghādisesan”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:3.19.1.eng: ‘If a nun walks to the next inhabited area by herself or crosses a river by herself or spends the night apart by herself, then that nun too has committed an immediate offense entailing sending away and suspension.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:3.20.pli: Evañcidaṃ bhagavatā bhikkhunīnaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:3.20.eng: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the nuns.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:4.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sambahulā bhikkhuniyo kosalesu janapade sāvatthiṃ addhānamaggappaṭipannā honti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:4.1.eng: On one occasion a number of nuns were traveling through the Kosalan country on their way to Sāvatthī.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:4.2.pli: Tattha aññatarā bhikkhunī vaccena pīḷitā ekikā ohīyitvā pacchā agamāsi.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:4.2.eng: One of the nuns, needing to defecate, stayed behind by herself, and then followed behind the others.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:4.3.eng: People saw her and raped her.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:4.4.pli: Atha kho sā bhikkhunī yena tā bhikkhuniyo tenupasaṅkami. Bhikkhuniyo taṃ bhikkhuniṃ etadavocuṃ—“kissa tvaṃ, ayye, ekikā ohīnā, kaccisi appadhaṃsitā”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:4.4.eng: She then went to the other nuns, and they said to her, “Why did you stay behind by yourself, Venerable? We hope you weren’t assaulted?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:4.6.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:4.6.eng: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:4.7.pli: kathañhi nāma bhikkhunī ekā gaṇamhā ohīyissatīti …pe…
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:4.7.eng: “How could a nun lag behind her companions by herself?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:4.8.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, bhikkhunī ekā gaṇamhā ohīyatī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:4.8.eng: “Is it true, monks, that a nun did this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:4.11.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, bhikkhunī ekā gaṇamhā ohīyissati.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:4.13.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:4.13.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:4.14.1.pli: “Yā pana bhikkhunī ekā vā gāmantaraṃ gaccheyya, ekā vā nadīpāraṃ gaccheyya, ekā vā rattiṃ vippavaseyya, ekā vā gaṇamhā ohīyeyya, ayampi bhikkhunī paṭhamāpattikaṃ dhammaṃ āpannā nissāraṇīyaṃ saṅghādisesan”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:4.14.1.eng: ‘If a nun walks to the next inhabited area by herself or crosses a river by herself or spends the night apart by herself or lags behind her companions by herself, then that nun too has committed an immediate offense entailing sending away and suspension.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:5.1.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:5.1.5.eng: Walks to the next inhabited area by herself:

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:5.1.6.pli: parikkhittassa gāmassa parikkhepaṃ paṭhamaṃ pādaṃ atikkāmentiyā āpatti thullaccayassa,
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:5.1.6.eng: if she crosses the boundary of an enclosed inhabited area with her first foot, she commits a serious offense.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:5.1.6.comm: For a discussion of the rendering “inhabited area” for gāma, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:5.1.7.eng: If she then crosses it with her second foot, she commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:5.1.8.pli: Aparikkhittassa gāmassa upacāraṃ paṭhamaṃ pādaṃ atikkāmentiyā āpatti thullaccayassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:5.1.8.eng: If she enters the vicinity of an unenclosed inhabited area with her first foot, she commits a serious offense.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:5.1.8.comm: For a discussion of the rendering “vicinity” for upacāra, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:5.1.9.eng: If she then enters it with her second foot, she commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:5.1.10.eng: Or crosses a river by herself:

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:5.1.11.pli: nadī nāma timaṇḍalaṃ paṭicchādetvā yattha katthaci uttarantiyā bhikkhuniyā antaravāsako temiyati.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:5.1.11.eng: A river: wherever, after covering the three circles, the sarong gets wet when the nun is crossing.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:5.1.12.eng: When she has crossed with the first foot, she commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:5.1.13.eng: When she has crossed with the second foot, she commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:5.1.14.eng: Or spends the night apart by herself:

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:5.1.15.pli: saha aruṇuggamanā dutiyikāya bhikkhuniyā hatthapāsaṃ vijahantiyā āpatti thullaccayassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:5.1.15.eng: if, at dawn, she is in the process of going beyond arm’s reach of her companion nun, she commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:5.1.16.eng: When she has gone beyond, she commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:5.1.17.eng: Or lags behind her companions by herself:

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:5.1.18.pli: agāmake araññe dutiyikāya bhikkhuniyā dassanūpacāraṃ vā savanūpacāraṃ vā vijahantiyā āpatti thullaccayassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:5.1.18.eng: if, in an uninhabited area, in the wilderness, she is in the process of going beyond the range of sight or the range of hearing of her companion nun, she commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:5.1.19.eng: When she has gone beyond, she commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:5.1.21.eng: this is said with reference to the preceding offenses.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:5.1.23.eng: there is an offense as soon as the misconduct is committed, and no pressing is required.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:5.1.25.eng: she is sent away from the Sangha.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:5.1.27.eng: … Therefore, too, it is called an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:5.2.2.pli: dutiyikā bhikkhunī pakkantā vā hoti vibbhantā vā kālaṅkatā vā pakkhasaṅkantā vā,
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:5.2.2.eng: if her companion nun has left or disrobed or died or joined another group;
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:5.2.2.comm: Sp 2.693 defines pakkhasaṅkantā as joining another religion: Pakkhasaṅkantā vāti titthāyatanaṁ saṅkantā, “Pakkhasaṅkantā vā means one who has joined the ascetics of another religion.” Yet the idea of pakkha also refers to groups or factions within the Sangha, for instance, when the Sangha is split into different communities (nānāsaṁvāsa) that no longer perform legal procedures together. As such, it is a term for a separate sect of Buddhism.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:5.2.5.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:5.2.6.eng: The third offense entailing suspension is finished.
